result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chelsey R. Leith

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
Defendant must agree to drug/alcohol testing if law enforcement requests it.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
Between 5pm and 8am defendant can only leave the home for child visitation and/or work purposes.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

11:26 AM Defendant Chelsey R. Leith in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Chelsey R. Leith.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Chelsey R. Leith.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant currently has a $20,000 cash bond. Defense would like a lower cash bond perhaps $3,000-$5,000. State does not object. 
Court orders $1,000 cash bond with conditions.

Status Conference: 11/18/22 at 8:45am

ADDRESS INFO for Chelsey R. Leith
Current: 927 Lake Rd, Altoona, WI 54720 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 11795 29th Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729

Conditions: 
Defendant must agree to drug/alcohol testing if law enforcement requests it.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
Between 5pm and 8am defendant can only leave the home for child visitation and/or work purposes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Case called at 10:39 AM.
Defendant Chelsey R. Leith in court, in custody with Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond and Attorney Katherine Cook. Attorney Tiffany Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
STC: 10/3/22 at 11:00 AM.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chelsey R. Leith in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Chelsey R. Leith. 
State calls Sergeant Jacob Henning to testify- is sworn and testifies. 
2:43 PM State offers Exhibits #1. 
2:48 PM State offers Exhibit #2. 
Record to reflect identification of the Defendant by the witness- Court notes Defense's objection. 
Exhibits #1 and #2 are received by the Court. 
State asks court to take judicial notice of defendant's bonds in Dunn County cases and prior convictions in Eau Claire County. No objection from the Defense- Court takes judicial notice of bonds and prior convictions. 
Cross examination by the Defense. Witness is excused. 
State rests and asks for bind over. Defense argues against bind over. 
Court makes a statement and finds probable cause for bind over. An ARGN is to be scheduled in Branch 4.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:01 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Chelsey R. Leith appeared by video, without counsel and  in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. State requests $20,000 Cash Bond (Facing lengthy exposure, Class C Felony, History of Warrants and Failures to appear). Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court orders $20,000 Cash Bond. Attorney Sonia Anderson to notify the St. Croix County Public Defender's Officer that the Defendant is requesting an attorney.
Preliminary Hearing: 5/17/22 at 2:00 PM (In Person).

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
